awd_titl_txt: Model Theory and Applications 2022, Cetraro, Italy
awd_abstract_narration:
This award supports US-based participants, particularly graduate students and recent doctoral recipients, to attend the international conference "Model Theory and Applications 2022" held on June 20-25, 2020 in Cetraro (Italy). Model theory is the study of classes of mathematical structures in the context of mathematical logic. The goal of the conference is to present a general overview of recent developments in model theory and its applications.

Topics of the conference include pure model theory (neostability, o-minimality), as well as applications to dynamics, combinatorics, geometry, and other neighboring areas. This award provides an opportunity for US-based early-career researchers and PhD students to learn from leading experts and to actively engage in research on these recent developments. More details are available at the conference website https://www.matfis.unicampania.it/home-model-theory

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: UNIVERSITY OF NOTRE DAME DU LAC

por.por_cntn:
The project provided funding to support US-based participants, particularly graduate students and recent Ph.Ds, to attend the conference Model Theory and Applications 2022 that took place at a conference center in Cetraro, Italy, on 20-25 June 2022.
The aim of the conference was to bring together experts, early stage researchers and graduate students from the model theory community. The topics covered in the talks were of interdisciplinary character: on applied side the conference highlighted connections between model theory and such subjects as Combinatorics, Diaphontine geometry, Algebraic Geometry and Number Theory, Free and Hyperbolic groups, Approximate subgroups, Berkovich spaces, Topological Dynamics. On the pure side  conference researchers stuied these new developments as well as other subjects such as continous logic and their extensions to a wide range of mathematical theories.
This meeting was one of the main model theory conference of the summer 2022, and the grant helped the US based researchers to get actively involved in these current developments, leading to further research and collaboration.
In particular, the award allowed several US based early stage researchers and Ph.D students to actively engage in one-on-one and small group research on cutting-edge topics in model-theory and algebra with the leading experts in the area. The meeting led to continuation of existing and creation of new collaborations, A dedicated poster session held during the meeting provided an opportunity for younger participants to gain scientific presentation experience and receive feedback from the experts.

 


Last Modified: 09/16/2023
Modified by: Sergei Starchenko
